page.title: 05MECHANISED FARMING,ST.ALLEN.
page.content: 25 years ago,corn stood in stooks, horses worked,Lanner Barton employed 6 men.Now mechanisation has reduced labour,Mr.Gay uses technology to cut costs & make life easier.Using a 1983 Czechoslovakian Zetor tractor he has the"FLAT 8"system for haymaking with a pickup square-baler,automatic sledge, a grab on the tractor-loader picking up 8 bales onto a trailer for transfer to shed where bales are handled onto an elevator & stacked by 2 men.Grain from a bulk tank on combine harvester unloads into trailers thence into grainstore via augers for storage on a ventilated floor,dried to 16% moisture content to prevent overheating.Farm manure goes on loader into spreader & onto grassfields.With 3 men working & mechanisation there's time to maintain Cornish hedges,gates & buildings & go to shows markets & demonstrations.
